tool.name: EICExtractor
tool.description: Extracts intensities from dedicates positions in a LC/MS map
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ${ ' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in/%s.%s' &&" % (_, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in if _]) } #if $in_header: mkdir in_header && ${ ' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in_header/%s.%s' &&" % (_, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in_header if _]) } #end if mkdir pos && ln -s '$pos' 'pos/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $pos.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($pos.ext)' && mkdir out && #if "out_debug_TIC_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir auto_rt_out_debug_TIC && #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && export PYTHONPATH='$__tool_directory__/CTDopts/' && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in ${' '.join(["'in/%s.%s'"%(re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in if _])} #if $in_header: -in_header ${' '.join(["'in_header/%s.%s'"%(re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in_header if _])} #end if -pos 'pos/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $pos.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($pos.ext)' -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("csv")}' #if "out_debug_TIC_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -auto_rt:out_debug_TIC 'auto_rt_out_debug_TIC/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' #end if #if len(str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',')) == 0 | tee '$stdout' #end if
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("csv")}' '$out' #if "out_debug_TIC_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'auto_rt_out_debug_TIC/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' '$auto_rt_out_debug_TIC' #end if #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in_header
param.label: [for Waters data only] Read additional information from _HEADER.TXT
param.help: Provide one for each raw input file select txt data sets(s)

param.name: pos
param.label: Input config file stating where to find signal

param.name: rt_tol
param.label: RT tolerance in [s] for finding max peak (whole RT range around RT middle)

param.name: mz_tol
param.label: m/z tolerance in [ppm] for finding a peak

param.name: rt_collect
param.label: # of scans up & down in RT from highest point for ppm estimation in result

section.name: auto_rt
section.title: Parameters for automatic detection of injection RT peaks (no need to specify them in 'pos' input file)

param.name: enabled
param.label: Automatically detect injection peaks from TIC and quantify all m/z x RT combinations

param.name: FHWM
param.label: Expected full width at half-maximum of each raw RT peak in [s]
param.help: Gaussian smoothing filter with this width is applied to TIC

param.name: SNThreshold
param.label: S/N threshold for a smoothed raw peak to pass peak picking
param.help: Higher thesholds will result in less peaks

param.name: out_separator
param.label: Separator character for output CSV file

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs
param.option: out_debug_TIC (Optional output file (for first input) containing the smoothed TIC, S/N levels and picked RT positions)

data.name: auto_rt_out_debug_TIC
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: auto_rt:out_debug_TIC
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_debug_TIC_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Extracts intensities from dedicates positions in a LC/MS map
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/documentation/TOPP_EICExtractor.html
